intro: Aeollanthus calvus, commonly known as the smoothleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Aeollanthus calvus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
